intro: Carduncellus lanatus, commonly known as the woolly carduncellus, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a tall, hairy stem and large, lobed leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. Carduncellus lanatus is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
